en: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1826 Oct. 28

This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This excerpt is from the 1826 term of court, specifically the Saturday October 28 session. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

none: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1826 Oct. 28 : page 1

body.value: October and November Saturday 28th Court met agreeable to adjournment Present John Martin , James Brown , Walter S. Adair & J. James Daniel Charles R. Hicks Ptf Plaintiff vs James Brown William Williams Jenny Williams Dfts Defendants Slander for the words of robbery or stealing The Court decides that the charges alledged alleged against the plaintiff for the above offences, has not been proven, and that there is nothing porporting purporting in the instructions, given by Charles R. Hicks, to a certain Company of men appertaining to theft or robbery and that the plaintiff is honorably acquited acquitted of any such charges J Martin C. S. C Cherokee Nation vs Edward Crittenton Talaskee No prosecutor Dismissed Michael Heldebrand Ptf vs Sleeping Rabbit & son Dft Court find for the defendant
